chunks.en: Dataflare: A simple and lightweight database manager
Dataflare is an easy-to-use database manager designed to help you better manage your databases, easily manage tables, view data, and write SQL queries.

chunks.en: Currently, it supports connecting to libSQL, MariaDB, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Rqlite, SQLCipher, SQLite, and SQL Server databases, and more will be added later.

chunks.zh: è½»é‡å°å·§ï¼Œåªæœ‰ 20M+ å·¦å³çš„ä½“ç§¯ï¼Œæ”¯æŒ macOS, Windows, Linux ã€‚
chunks.en: It's lightweight and compact, with a size of only around 20MB+, and supports macOS, Windows, and Linux.

![Create Table]( https://assets.dataflare.app/posts/2024-02-01-001.png)
![Schema Manager]( https://assets.dataflare.app/posts/2024-02-01-002.png)
![Preview Table]( https://assets.dataflare.app/posts/2024-02-01-003.png)
![SQL Editor]( https://assets.dataflare.app/posts/2024-02-01-004.png)

### Pricing

Price: `$39`. If you like it, you can pay to support it.
Currently, free users can also use all features, but some restrictions may be added for free users in the future.

#### Discounts

* 90% off (10): **Y1MDCYMG**
* 50% off: **Q5NJCWNW**

---

I posted here before, and everyone gave a lot of good suggestions, thank you very much.
There are still many shortcomings now, and development will be accelerated after the Chinese New Year. Welcome everyone to try it â¤ï¸, and also welcome everyone to make any suggestions!
Twitter: [@Dataflare]( https://twitter.com/DataflareApp)
Well, there's DataGrip and Dbeaver already...
Website: https://dataflare.app

I used it when you posted before, but the previous version didn't seem to have Chinese. For native Chinese people, it is unacceptable that software developed by Chinese people does not support Chinese.
Although I can understand simple English, maybe the software's target users are not Chinese.
> Currently, free users can also use all features, but some restrictions may be added for free users in the future.
Either don't let free users use all the features at the beginning, or it's a big taboo to cut existing features from the users' hands.
Since it's paid, you should develop exclusive and novel features for paid users separately. Cutting features that were once free for paid users can only be said to be unsatisfying for both sides.

chunks.en: @wyhaya Your icon. I actually saw jagged edges on 4K... Also, on Windows, I customized the installation path... it reported an error... There is Table Plus on Mac, I haven't tried it yet. It's pretty good, looking forward to the update... Hope to add Redis.

Already bought it with -90% off, hoping for more license numbers. I have a Windows machine and a Mac, and I have to keep deactivating and reactivating them to use them together. It would be great if it could be used on three.
@murongxdb The next version will include @outtime @ponelyr @wukaige. Thanks for the support!
-90% off supported one order
Natively does not support Chinese
@gniviliving Exactly, it's not that I don't understand English, it's just that Chinese looks more friendly. I can't live without Navicat's structure comparison and data synchronization.

@gniviliving @dianso The main reason is that this software is aimed at programmers, and secondly, it's relatively simple and doesn't have things like articles. The software is still in its early stages, so I was thinking of doing English first.
Chinese will definitely be supported.
-90% off supported one order for the features I most hope for: Chinese support, SQL generation upon modification, and structure comparison
@lzgshsj First time making a product, I don't quite understand the intricacies. I will reconsider.
Thank you very much.
@wyhaya #9 Can you view DDL statements?
@QlanQ Chinese support will be added
Wow, 10% off, I bought it even though I don't need it, ğŸ˜„
@QlanQ Not yet, there are many similar features, and they will be gradually improved in the future.
39 USD??? Is it that expensive?
